metadata.title: CVE-2019-10072 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The fix for CVE-2019-0199 was incomplete and did not address HTTP/2connection window exhaustion on write in Apache Tomcat versions 9.0.0.M1 to9.0.19 and 8.5.0 to 8.5.40 . By not sending WINDOW_UPDATE messages for theconnection window (stream 0) clients were able to cause server-side threadsto block eventually leading to thread exhaustion and a DoS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10072` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
libtomcat9-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
tomcat9 - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
tomcat9-admin - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
tomcat9-common - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
tomcat9-examples - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
tomcat9-user - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
libtomcat8-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
tomcat8 - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
tomcat8-admin - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
tomcat8-common - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
tomcat8-examples - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
tomcat8-user - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat9 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.1').
tomcat8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3').
